p: The HBV-reporter cell line, HepG2.2.15 is one of the established systems for preliminary screening of anti-HBV drugs in vitro. The in silico molecular docking tool enables to assess the binding ability of a ligand to protein active-site as well as to compare the binding modes of different ligands to the active site-pocket ( Leach, 2001). Therefore, in this study, we evaluated the novel anti-HBV activity as well as delineated mechanism of action of selected plant-derived compounds of different classes, using cell culture and molecular docking methods.
